results.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
results.brief_description: The Day the Earth Stood Still is a 1951 American black-and-white science fiction film about an alien visitor named Klaatu that comes to Earth, accompanied by a powerful eight-foot tall robot to deliver an important message that will affect the entire human race.

constellations_other.name: Good vibrations
constellations_other.description: Since its invention, the humble theremin has been used in a number of different ways to evoke all sorts of strange sounds and moods.

constellations_other.name: Electric Sound Supercut: composers and their distinctive other worlds
constellations_other.description: Electric sound is commonly associated with science fiction narratives for its auditory oddness, which has symbolised other worldly environments, the unconscious and the 1980s.

results.description: The Day the Earth Stood Still is a 1951 American black-and-white science fiction film about an alien visitor named Klaatu that comes to Earth, accompanied by a powerful eight-foot tall robot to deliver an important message that will affect the entire human race.

results.title: The D-Generation
results.brief_description: The D-Generation was a popular and influential Australian TV sketch comedy show, produced and broadcast by the Australian Broadcasting Corporation for two series, between 1986 and 1987. A further four specials were broadcast on the Seven Network between 1988 and 1989.
results.description: The D-Generation was a popular and influential Australian TV sketch comedy show, produced and broadcast by the Australian Broadcasting Corporation for two series, between 1986 and 1987. A further four specials were broadcast on the Seven Network between 1988 and 1989.
description_for_label: The D-Generation was a popular and influential Australian TV sketch comedy show, produced and broadcast by the Australian Broadcasting Corporation for two series, between 1986 and 1987. A further four specials were broadcast on the Seven Network between 1988 and 1989.

results.title: The Cremaster Cycle: A Conversation with Matthew Barney
results.brief_description: For his five Cremaster films Matthew Barney’s created a multitude of sculptural forms and structures. Recently both the sculptures and the films traveled to museums in Cologne, Paris and New York’s Guggenheim. In THE CREMASTER CYCLE: A Conversation with Matthew Barney, the artist guides the camera through this remarkable creation at the Guggenheim Museum while being questioned by Michael Kimmelman, chief art critic of the New York Times.

results.title: The Constant Gardener
results.creator_credit: Blue Sky Films, Scion Films, Studio Babelsberg, Epsilon Motion Pictures, UK Film Council, Focus Features, Potboiler Productions, Odile Dicks-Mireaux, Tracey Seaward, Thierry Potok, Simon Channing Williams, Fernando Meirelles, Mark Tildesley, Jeffrey Caine and Henning Molfenter
results.headline_credit: China, Germany, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2005
results.brief_description: Justin Quayle is a low-level British diplomat who has always gone about his work very quietly, not causing any problems. But after his radical wife Tessa is killed he becomes determined to find out why, thrusting himself into the middle of a very dangerous conspiracy.

constellations_other.name: My People
constellations_other.description: The breakout single for Sydney dance duo The Presets, 'My People' was one of the biggest hits of 2007 and propelled by the engaging music video.

results.title: The Clock
results.brief_description: The Clock is a 24-hour video installation created from thousands of clips of clocks, watches and other references to time from film and television.

constellations_other.name: Taking it slow
constellations_other.description: Daniel Crooks' Phantom Ride offers a meditative journey through digital landscapes that make the viewer pause and reflect.

results.description: A 24-hour compendium of time-themed film clips, all synched to the time that appears on the clocks and watches within.
description_for_label: A 24-hour compendium of time-themed film clips, all synched to the time that appears on the clocks and watches within.

results.title: The Circle
results.creator_credit: Playtone, Image Nation, Likely Story, STX Entertainment, Tom Hanks, Gary Goetzman, Anthony Bregman, James Ponsoldt, Gerald Sullivan, Dave Eggers, Walter F. Parkes and Emma Potter
results.brief_description: A young tech worker takes a job at a powerful Internet corporation, quickly rises up the company’s ranks, and soon finds herself in a perilous situation concerning privacy, surveillance and freedom. She comes to learn that her decisions and actions will determine the future of humanity.

constellations_other.name: The entire history of you
constellations_other.description: Bellingcat is a journalism collective using social media platforms and surveillance footage for their investigations.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Playtone, Image Nation, Likely Story, STX Entertainment, Tom Hanks, Gary Goetzman, Anthony Bregman, James Ponsoldt, Gerald Sullivan, Dave Eggers, Walter F. Parkes and Emma Potter

results.title: The Cheaters
results.brief_description: An embezzler, Bill Marsh, swears vengeance on a businessman, John Travers, who has turned him in to the police. Twenty years pass, and Marsh emerges from jail and establishes himself as the head of a powerful crime empire, with his daughter, Paula, serving as bait to attract wealthy victims.

constellations_other.name: Voice and the moving image
constellations_other.description: Sound changed cinema, but it wasn't always welcome, but it hasn't stopped people aspiring for the spotlight.

results.description: An embezzler, Bill Marsh, swears vengeance on a businessman, John Travers, who has turned him in to the police. Twenty years pass, and Marsh emerges from jail and establishes himself as the head of a powerful crime empire, with his daughter, Paula, serving as bait to attract wealthy victims. Paula falls in love with Lee Travers, the adopted son of Marsh’s old enemy, and begins to have doubts about her life of crime. Only after a series of tragic incidents is she set free to marry Lee and start life anew. This silent feature was highly regarded for its set design and ‘unusual sensitivity to the expressive range of the camera and their awareness of careful scenario construction as a key to emotionally powerful cinema’. Cast includes Marie Lorraine, Arthur Greenaway, John Faulkner. A sound version was attempted soon after but was not successful and was never released.
description_for_label: An embezzler, Bill Marsh, swears vengeance on a businessman, John Travers, who has turned him in to the police. Twenty years pass, and Marsh emerges from jail and establishes himself as the head of a powerful crime empire, with his daughter, Paula, serving as bait to attract wealthy victims. Paula falls in love with Lee Travers, the adopted son of Marsh’s old enemy, and begins to have doubts about her life of crime. Only after a series of tragic incidents is she set free to marry Lee and start life anew. This silent feature was highly regarded for its set design and ‘unusual sensitivity to the expressive range of the camera and their awareness of careful scenario construction as a key to emotionally powerful cinema’. Cast includes Marie Lorraine, Arthur Greenaway, John Faulkner. A sound version was attempted soon after but was not successful and was never released.

results.title: The Chant of Jimmie Blacksmith
results.creator_credit: Victorian Film, The Film House, Bruce Finlayson, Fred Schepisi and Wendy Dickson
results.brief_description: In the late 1970s, non-Indigenous filmmakers wanting to support Indigenous Rights in Australia released films on Black Australia to mixed success. Fred Schepisi’s controversial The Chant of Jimmie Blacksmith (1978) divided audiences and demonstrated how non-Indigenous storytellers could co-opt Indigenous stories to great detriment.

constellations_other.name: Aboriginal History Archive
constellations_other.description: The Aboriginal History Archive at Victoria University, led by Gary Foley, is dedicated to the collection and preservation of First Peoples' stories and cultural material. The political activism of the Black Power movement in the 1970s is intersected with representation of Aboriginal actors on screen.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Victorian Film, The Film House, Bruce Finlayson, Fred Schepisi and Wendy Dickson
results.description: The true story of a part aboriginal man who finds the pressure of adapting to white culture intolerable, and as a result snaps in a violent and horrific manner.
description_for_label: The true story of a part aboriginal man who finds the pressure of adapting to white culture intolerable, and as a result snaps in a violent and horrific manner.

video_links.name: The Chant Of Jimmie Blacksmith Trailer

results.title: The Celebration
results.brief_description: A grandiose party to celebrate a sixtieth birthday unleashes a family drama with all the lies that conceal horrendous secrets. The eldest son, Christian, stages a showdown with the popular pater familias; his provocative, moving after-dinner speech dislodges all the masks, which finally fall completely as the father-son conflict intensifies and the bewildered guests look on.

constellations_other.name: A handheld aesthetic
constellations_other.description: Looking at the use of handycams and other consumer level devices in moving image works.

results.description: A grandiose party to celebrate a sixtieth birthday unleashes a family drama with all the lies that conceal horrendous secrets. results.title: The Cat Piano
results.brief_description: A city of singing cats is preyed upon by a shadowy figure intent on performing a twisted feline symphony.

constellations_other.name: City of animals (Hollow Knight - Production Design)
constellations_other.description: The adorable bugs that occupy Hallownest in the game Hollow Knight aren't the first anthropomorphised critters in film.
